result.execSummary:
The defendant Tramon Lontrell Bean was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges by 11-10-15 or, in the alternative, serve 3 days in HOC, with credit for 3 days served. Court deems sentence satisfied.

Submit a DNA sample; pay the DNA surcharge by 03-11-16 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tramon Lontrell Bean

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tramon Lontrell Bean in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 11-10-2015 or, in the alternative, serve 3 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served.  Court deems sentence satisfied.

Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge by March 11, 2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Tramon Lontrell Bean in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreed Upon Request For a New Court Date received, signed, and filed with court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
 Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tramon Lontrell Bean in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 24 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-21-2015 at 1:30pm
